meanings.definition: The medium through which radio waves are transmitted.
meanings.sent1: The airwave carried the radio signal to my car.
meanings.sent2: I heard the news on the airwave this morning.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to ride the airwave like a magic carpet.
meanings.sent4: Her voice traveled through the airwave, reaching every corner of the room.
meanings.sent5: The airwave hummed with the melody of the music, filling the room with sound.

meanings.definition: A frequency band used for radio or television broadcasting.
meanings.sent1: The radio station broadcasted on the airwave all day.
meanings.sent2: I tuned in to the popular show on the airwave.
meanings.sent3: The airwave seemed to dance with different frequencies, like a rainbow of sound.
meanings.sent4: The airwave was crowded with signals, like a busy highway of information.
meanings.sent5: The airwave crackled with static, disrupting the broadcast.

meanings.definition: To broadcast or transmit over the airwaves.
meanings.sent1: The radio host will airwave the interview tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: They airwave the news every hour on the station.
meanings.sent3: The magician claimed he could airwave his thoughts to the audience.
meanings.sent4: She decided to airwave her message to the world through social media.
meanings.sent5: The singer's voice seemed to airwave effortlessly, captivating the audience.
